title: Twelve Stones of Remembrance
summary: Joshua 4 describes how twelve stones were taken from the Jordan River as a memorial of Godâ€™s faithfulness. These stones served as a reminder to future generations of how God stopped the river for Israel.

faq.question: What were the twelve stones for?
faq.answer: To remind future generations of the miracle at the Jordan River.

faq.question: Where were the stones placed?
faq.answer: They were set up at Gilgal, where Israel camped after crossing the Jordan.
